prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. It has a slightly tapered shape, with the top being wider than the bottom, and the sides of the prism are parallel to each other. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch** on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. **Create the first face** by drawing lines: - Line 1: Starting point at [0.0, 0.5], ending point at [0.125, 0.5] - Line 2: Starting point at [0.125, 0.5], ending point at [0.125, 0.0] - Line 3: Starting point at [0.125, 0.0], ending point at [0.375, 0.0] - Line 4: Starting point at [0.375, 0.0], ending point at [0.375, 0.5] - Line 5: Starting point at [0.375, 0.5], ending point at [0.5, 0.5] - Line 6: Starting point at [0.5, 0.5], ending point at [0.5, 0.75] - Line 7: Starting point at [0.5, 0.75], ending point at [0.0, 0.75] - Line 8: Starting point at [0.0, 0.75], ending point at [0.0, 0.5] This face has a single loop and is closed. 4. **Scale the 2D sketch** using the sketch scaling parameter of 0.75. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch** along the normal to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.5 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction, resulting in a prism shape. The final dimensions of the part are as follows: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.5 - Height: 0.75</description>

The resulting part is a rectangular prism with a sloped side at a 45 degree angle. Finalizing Part 1 The first part of the CAD assembly is now complete. Make sure to save the part and move on to creating the next part, following the instructions for part 2. The length of the part is 1.137 units, the width is 0.5955 units, and the height is also 1.137 units due to the sloped side.</description>
